segment.source: Just as people use a combination of voice and gesture when communicating with each other, multiple types and modes of input can also be useful when interacting with an app.
segment.target: Just as people use a combination of voice and gesture when communicating with each other, multiple types and modes of input can also be useful when interacting with an app.

segment.source: To accommodate as many users and devices as possible, we recommend that you design your apps to work with as many input types as possible (gesture, speech, touch, touchpad, mouse, and keyboard).
segment.target: To accommodate as many users and devices as possible, we recommend that you design your apps to work with as many input types as possible (gesture, speech, touch, touchpad, mouse, and keyboard).

segment.source: Doing so will maximize flexibility, usability, and accessibility.
segment.target: Doing so will maximize flexibility, usability, and accessibility.

segment.source: To begin, consider the various scenarios in which your app handles input.
segment.target: To begin, consider the various scenarios in which your app handles input.

segment.source: Try to be consistent throughout your app, and remember that the platform controls provide built-in support for multiple input types.
segment.target: Try to be consistent throughout your app, and remember that the platform controls provide built-in support for multiple input types.

segment.source: With single-mode interactions, multiple input types are supported, but only one can be used per action.
segment.target: With single-mode interactions, multiple input types are supported, but only one can be used per action.

segment.source: For example, speech recognition for commands, and gestures for navigation; or, text entry using touch or gestures, depending on proximity.
segment.target: For example, speech recognition for commands, and gestures for navigation; or, text entry using touch or gestures, depending on proximity.
